intro: Yushania elevata, commonly known as the tall bamboo or highland bamboo, is a perennial grass native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender culms that can reach heights of up to 10 meters, making it one of the tallest bamboo species. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically green on the upper surface and lighter in color on the underside. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Yushania elevata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
